intro: Libanothamnus × wurdackii, commonly known as the hybrid dune morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant purple or pink blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
